body.p: Your petitioner John Schroeder respectfully states that he is only 15 years and two months old. He states that he was found guilty on the 14th instant in the Jefferson Circuit Court of the charge of maliciously stabbing Andrew Doran on the 3rd Sept last. He was indicted tried and found guilty with his father David Schroeder. He states that he was present and witnessed the difficulty that took place at the time, between Doran and his father but that he your petitioner took no part in the difficulty. The jury found his father guilty and said that he should be confined in the penetentiary for two years and your petitioner one, but the ^Jury^ recommended your petitioner to the clemency of your Excellency. He makes an attested copy of the verdict part hereof. He prays your Excellency to pardon him and he will ever pray &c.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 17th 1864 by John Schroeder.

John N. Mattingly
Notary Public Jeff Co Ky
We the undersigned pray your Excellency to grant the foregoing petition

John N. Mattingly
M A Walker
Philip Fiskey
I respectfully unite with the Jury in recommending the boy John Shroeder to Executive clemency
I have known the petitioner John Schroeder for four years last past. His father is my near neighbor. John is a peaceable good natured boy and I believe him a good & honest.
